newsitem.title: UK: CU posts Q1 advance in profits.
newsitem.headline: CU posts Q1 advance in profits.

text.p: British insurer Commercial Union Plc on Wednesday reported a 23 percent rise in pre-tax operating profits for the first quarter helped by lower U.S. weather claims and growth in its life business.
Profits rose to 102 million pounds ($166.4 million), up from 83 million pounds in the same period last year.

The strength of sterling again took a toll and at comparable exchange rates operating profits were up 46 percent. On the same basis both profits and new business sales at the group's worldwide life business rose 25 percent over the three months to March 31.
In general insurance a milder winter helped U.S. results and France and Australia also saw increases in profits.
However, continuing competition in the UK reduced UK general insurance profits.
Commenting on the figures, chief executive John Carter described the company's prospects as "excellent".

"Our substantial worldwide life businesses are well positioned to continue their strong progress, underpinned by demographic changes and our investment in newer markets," he said. ($ = 0.613 British Pounds)
